page.title: 03A Burgess Hill Vineyard
page.content: There is a vineyard at{Freckborough {Manor}on{Ditchling Common.}It has been running for ten years and has one thousand vines. It produces{white wine from Reichensteiner and Muller Thurgau grapes. The wine takes one year to mature. In early July, we saw the flowers on the vines turning into small, hard green berries. In October these become ripe grapes. It takes five kilos of them to make one bottle of wine. The wine is made amd bottled at Lamberhurst in Kent. It is then returned to the vineyard, where people can buy it. It costs{Â£3.40}for a bottle. The vineyard produces and sells{two {thousand bottles of white wine a year. {}
